Package domain.Validators

Interface Validator<ID,​T extends BaseEntity<ID>>

Type Parameters:
T - Entity to be validated.
All Known Implementing Classes:
AddressValidator, ClientValidator, CoffeeValidator, OrderValidator
public interface Validator<ID,​T extends BaseEntity<ID>>
Interface for generic validation operations.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void checkId​(ID id, java.lang.String message)  
    static java.lang.Object checkInput​(java.lang.String input, java.lang.String checkAgainst, java.lang.Boolean shouldBeNumber)
    Helper function that checks the equality between an input string and another one and returns the input if they are not equal or converts it into a null otherwise
    void checkNull​(java.lang.Object obj, java.lang.String errorMessage)  
    void validate​(T entity)  
    T verifyNullableFields​(T entity)
    Method for setting the null fields of an entity accordingly in case they were badly read from an xml file

  • Method Details

    • validate

      void validate​(T entity) throws ValidatorException
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity that is checked.
      Throws:
      ValidatorException - if there is an invalid property.

    • checkNull

      void checkNull​(java.lang.Object obj, java.lang.String errorMessage) throws ValidatorException
      Parameters:
      obj - The object that will be checked.
      errorMessage - The the message of the exception.
      Throws:
      ValidatorException - if the object is null.

    • checkId

      void checkId​(ID id, java.lang.String message) throws ValidatorException
      Parameters:
      id - The id that will be checked.
      message - The the message of the exception.
      Throws:
      ValidatorException - if the id is invalid.

    • verifyNullableFields

      T verifyNullableFields​(T entity)
      Method for setting the null fields of an entity accordingly in case they were badly read from an xml file
      Parameters:
      entity - : the entity to be checked and updated
      Returns:
      T: the checked and updated entity

    • checkInput

      static java.lang.Object checkInput​(java.lang.String input, java.lang.String checkAgainst, java.lang.Boolean shouldBeNumber) throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
      Helper function that checks the equality between an input string and another one and returns the input if they are not equal or converts it into a null otherwise
      Parameters:
      input - : the input string to be verified
      Returns:
      String: null if the string was empty or the string itself otherwise
      Throws:
      java.lang.NumberFormatException
